jobs.title: Software Engineer (Full Stack), AI/ML Products
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Software Engineer (Full Stack), AI/ML Products

In Brief

  • We’re a rapidly growing startup on a mission to make healthcare proactive by empowering physicians, nurses, and care team members with real-time data to save lives.

  • We’re looking for a software engineer with a breadth of experience across technical stacks who’s eager to make an impact in the health AI space.

Who We Are

Bayesian Health’s mission is to improve patient outcomes by empowering clinicians with the insights they need to make the right decision for the right patient at the point-of-care. We’re a diverse team of clinicians, engineers, machine learning experts, product designers, and performance improvement leaders committed to enabling smarter, patient-specific care delivery through unlocking the power of data.

We’re funded by top tier tech and biotech investors: Obvious Ventures, Andreessen Horowitz, American Medical Association’s venture arm, Catalio Partners, and LifeForce Capital. Our company has won many awards; most recent recognitions include: Forbes AI Top 50, World Economic Forum Tech Pioneer, Time Best Inventions, BioTech AI Company of the Year.

Read more about our recent publication in Nature Medicine that associates our products with lives saved.

What you’ll do

As a Software Engineer (Full Stack), AI/ML Products, you will work closely with product managers, clinicians, data scientists, and other software engineers to develop and deploy clinical AI/ML products for enterprise health systems. This role is crucial to drive expansion of our clinical AI/ML module offerings and revenue growth.

Responsibilities

  • Full stack product development: Understand and translate clinical product requirements into an optimal technical design to build world-class clinical AI applications for our end users.

  • Testing: Ensure product correctness and quality through comprehensive unit, integration, and end-to-end tests.

  • Cross functional collaboration: Work closely with Product, Clinical, and Data Science to drive alignment and deliver impactful technology that saves lives.

Minimum qualifications

  • BS in Computer Science or other relevant technical discipline.

  • 3+ years of experience in developing and deploying production-quality full stack applications on a cloud platform (preferably AWS).

  • Experience with front-end frameworks (preferably React), API web services, and databases such as Postgresql, MySQL, and SQL Server.

  • Proficient in Typescript or Javascript.

  • Excellent communication skills and a proven ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams (e.g., product, data science) to translate requirements into robust technical solutions.

Preferred qualifications

  • Experience in leveraging LLMs in full stack application development and testing.

  • Experience with building health applications and integrating with electronic health records (EHR) systems.

  • Experience handling ambiguity and uncertainty in a startup.

Bayesian Health provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

jobs.title: Clinical Integration, Nurse Consultant
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Clinical Integration – Nurse Consultant

 

In Brief

  • We’re a rapidly growing startup on a mission to make healthcare proactive by empowering clinicians with real-time data to save lives.

  • We’re looking for a full-time nurse consultant with 5+ years of clinical experience as a registered nurse with a strong understanding of healthcare processes and workflows; demonstrated leadership skills and involvement with quality improvement and/or experience in clinical informatics/analytics roles.

Who We Are

We’re using state-of-the-art tech to build AI co-pilots for doctors and nurses to literally help them save lives! Read more about our recent publication in Nature Medicine that associates our products with lives saved.

We’re a diverse and experienced team of AI/ML experts, software engineers, product designers, behavior change specialists, and clinicians. We’re not afraid of hard problems and are highly results-oriented. We also like to have fun while we’re working on hard things. Our culture is highly collaborative, inclusive, supportive, and we have a strict “no jerks” policy.

We’re funded by top tier tech and biotech investors: Andreessen Horowitz, American Medical Association’s venture arm, Catalio Partners, and LifeForce Capital. Our company has won many awards; most recent recognitions include: Forbes AI Top 50, World Economic Forum Tech Pioneer, Time Best Inventions, BioTech AI Company of the Year.

What You’ll Do

This role is critical to our ability to accelerate and scale our clinical AI product deployment as we expand our client base.

You will:

  • Collaborate closely with clients to ensure successful integration of our solutions, providing exceptional support and guidance.

  • Conduct comprehensive chart reviews to identify opportunities for model refinement, potential enhancements to the product, and to gather success stories.

  • Build and nurture strong relationships with clinicians at client sites to facilitate seamless adoption and utilization of our technology.

  • Provide leadership and guidance to internal teams on clinical matters, leveraging your expertise to drive success.

  • Contribute to the development of presentations and participate in sales and marketing conversations, representing the nurse perspective, and demo product features.

  • Stay abreast of industry trends and advancements, contributing to the continuous improvement of our products and services.

  • Gain buy-in from nursing and physician stakeholders to drive adoption.

  • Support cross-functional team to build and deliver overarching narrative regarding value that Bayesian brings to each health system customer.

  • Support research and evaluation of Bayesian Health modules.

  • Identify gaps and barriers to achieving clinical outcomes and recommend countermeasures.

  • Contribute to the product roadmap by anticipating client needs.

  • Travel an average of 10% (including overnight) to client sites to provide support.

  • Be an integral part of our diverse, inclusive, collaborative, fully-remote Clinical team.

  • Other duties as assigned.

Who You Are

  • Clinical experience as a registered nurse, with a strong understanding of healthcare processes and workflows.

  • Demonstrated leadership skills, with the ability to inspire and motivate teams towards common goals.

  • Previous involvement with quality improvement teams (e.g. sepsis or HAPI) or experience in clinical informatics/analytics roles is highly desirable.

  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to effectively convey complex information to diverse audiences ranging from frontline clinicians to healthcare executives.

  • Flexibility and adaptability in a fast-changing environment, with the ability to thrive in a dynamic start-up culture.

  • Self-motivated and proactive, with a passion for driving innovation and improving healthcare outcomes.

  • You are passionate about making clinical care more effective and efficient. You believe technology has the power to inform clinical decisions early, and you want to make that a reality.

  • You have an executive presence and grit. You’re comfortable leading executive and frontline teams, and you’re able to articulate complex technology to audiences of varying backgrounds.

  • You’re results oriented. Everything you do contributes to achieving a specific outcome, and you have a track record of exceeding expectations.

  • Continuous improvement is in your DNA. You question the status quo and look for ways to drive efficiencies internally and externally.

  • You have a track record as a collaborative, driven team player with a high sense of ownership.

Nice to Haves

  • Demonstrated problem solving through research or projects

  • Ability to understand and interpret clinical research

Bayesian Health provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

jobs.title: Software Development Engineer in Test
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Software Development Engineer in Test

In Brief

  • We’re an early-stage startup on a mission to make healthcare proactive by empowering physicians, nurses, and care team members with real-time data to save lives.

  • You will play an instrumental role, working closely with product managers, clinicians, software engineers, data scientists, and regulatory, to ensure our clinical AI/ML products exceed enterprise health system quality standards and regulatory requirements for reliable, safe, and effective patient care.

Who We Are

Bayesian Health’s mission is to improve patient outcomes by empowering clinicians with the insights they need to make the right decision for the right patient at the point-of-care. We’re a diverse team of clinicians, engineers, machine learning experts, product designers, and performance improvement leaders committed to enabling smarter, patient-specific care delivery through unlocking the power of data.

We’re funded by top tier tech and biotech investors: Obvious Ventures, Andreessen Horowitz, American Medical Association’s venture arm, Catalio Partners, and LifeForce Capital. Our company has won many awards; most recent recognitions include: Forbes AI Top 50, World Economic Forum Tech Pioneer, Time Best Inventions, BioTech AI Company of the Year.

Read more about our recent publication in Nature Medicine that associates our products with lives saved.

What you’ll do

You will work closely with product managers, clinicians, client success, regulatory, data scientists, and other software engineers to develop verification protocols and automated tests ensuring we ship high quality, safe, secure, and regulatory-compliant clinical AI/ML products on a scalable and reliable platform for enterprise health systems. You’ll play an important role to expand and scale our clinical AI/ML module offerings with a high impact on our company revenue growth.

Responsibilities

  • Clinical AI/ML product quality: Partner with the product subject matter experts (SME) to define test requirements, create and execute test plans, both manual and automated, to ensure our products meet clinical workflow expectations, quality standards, and regulatory requirements.

  • Test automation: Build the framework and tooling to automatically run tests and verification efficiently that will enable us to accelerate our product development and integration.

  • Streamlining client integration testing: Consolidate and simplify integrated testing with our enterprise health system clients to reduce manual testing effort.

  • Cross Functional Collaboration: Work closely with product managers, clinicians, regulatory, data scientists, and other software engineers to drive alignment on quality at the company level and deliver impactful technology that saves lives.

Minimum qualifications

  • BS in Computer Science or other relevant technical discipline.

  • 5+ years of experience in leading testing for complex cross-functional technical projects.

  • 4+ years of experience in developing test cases using automated testing frameworks (Cypress, Selenium, etc.) and executing them in CI/CD pipelines.

  • 4+ years of writing and executing test plans, documenting test results, and tracking issue resolution in tools such as Jira, TestRail, etc.

  • Experience with testing EHR-integrated platforms or products (Epic or Cerner preferred).

  • Experience working cross-functionally with clinicians to align on workflow and product quality expectations.

Preferred qualifications

  • Experience with software processes compliant to IEC 62304/IEC 82304.

  • Experience with managing releases to ensure high quality products for enterprise customers.

  • Experience handling ambiguity and uncertainty in a startup.

Bayesian Health provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

jobs.title: Senior Forward Deployed Software Engineer, Full Stack
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Senior Forward Deployed Software Engineer, Full Stack

In Brief

  • We’re an early-stage startup on a mission to make healthcare proactive by empowering physicians, nurses, and care team members with real-time data to save lives.

  • You will lead and optimize enterprise-level client technical implementations, and help us build our growing Forward Deployed Engineering team. 

Who We Are 

Bayesian Health’s mission is to improve patient outcomes by empowering clinicians with the insights they need to make the right decision for the right patient at the point-of-care. We’re a diverse team of clinicians, engineers, machine learning experts, product designers, and performance improvement leaders committed to enabling smarter, patient-specific care delivery through unlocking the power of data.

We’re funded by top tier tech and biotech investors: Obvious Ventures, Andreessen Horowitz, American Medical Association’s venture arm, Catalio Partners, and LifeForce Capital. Our company has won many awards; most recent recognitions include: Forbes AI Top 50, World Economic Forum Tech Pioneer, Time Best Inventions, BioTech AI Company of the Year.

Read more about our recent publication in Nature Medicine that associates our products with lives saved.

What you’ll do 

Lead the integration of our clinical AI platform and application with our health system clients’ electronic health records (EHR) involving cross-functional collaboration with Client Success, Clinical, Product, and Data Science. You’ll play an important role in building automation and tooling to reduce integration resources and timeline that’s crucial as we expand our client base. Additionally, you will help us build the rest of the Forward Deployed team we are investing heavily in, given the importance and impact of these roles as our company grows. 

Responsibilities 

  • Leading enterprise client implementations: As the technical lead of a client project, you’ll work with the client to understand the best integration strategy, and own the planning and execution of the project end-to-end. 

  • Optimizing: Develop frameworks and tooling to increase efficiency and velocity of client implementations. 

  • End-to-end testing: Create and execute testing plans to ensure smooth and timely integrations. 

  • Team building: Partner with the Director of Engineering to define hiring strategy for future Forward Deployed Software Engineer hires. 

  • Cross-functional collaboration: Work closely with Client Success, Clinical, Product, and Data Science to drive alignment and deliver impactful technology that saves lives. 

Minimum qualifications 

  • BS in Computer Science or other relevant technical discipline, with 5+ years as a forward deployed engineer. 

  • 4+ years developing and deploying production quality full stack applications for clients (React, Typescript preferred)

  • 4+ years of experience creating and presenting technical design proposals that include technical specifications, implementation and test plans.

  • Experience using cloud solutions (AWS, Azure, etc) and relational databases (Postgresql, MySQL, etc) in a production environment. 

  • Strong communication and presentation skills

Preferred qualifications 

  • Experience with SMART on FHIR applications, integration with electronic health records (EHR) systems, and Health IT interoperability standards.

  • Experience working with enterprise customers, and the agility and responsiveness they require.

  • Excitement for Bayesian’s mission and being a bar raiser so we can accelerate the pace at which we create value.

Bayesian Health provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

jobs.title: Integration Lead, Implementation
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Integration Lead, Implementation

In Brief

  • We’re an early-stage startup that’s building a health AI platform to help clinicians make better use of real-time data to reduce preventable complications and save patient lives.

  • We’re looking for an integration lead who has a strong background in project management, particularly with managing technical implementations, and excels at scheduling, resource allocation, technical support and cross-functional coordination.

Who We Are

We’re using state-of-the-art tech to build AI co-pilots for doctors and nurses to literally help them save lives! Read more about our recent publication in Nature Medicine that associates our products with lives saved.

We’re a diverse and experienced team of AI/ML experts, software engineers, product designers, behavior change specialists, and clinicians. We’re not afraid of hard problems and are highly results-oriented. We also like to have fun while we’re working on hard things. Our culture is highly collaborative, inclusive, supportive, and we have a strict “no jerks” policy.

We’re funded by top tier tech and biotech investors: Andreessen Horowitz, American Medical Association’s venture arm, Catalio Partners, and LifeForce Capital. Our company has won many awards; most recent recognitions include: Forbes AI Top 50, World Economic Forum Tech Pioneer, Time Best Inventions, BioTech AI Company of the Year.

What You’ll Do

This role is critical to our ability to accelerate and scale our clinical AI product deployment as we expand our client base.

You Will Own:

  • Project Management: Lead client-facing health technology projects from inception to completion, ensuring deliverables meet quality standards and timelines using project management tools

  • Scheduling & Coordination: Develop and manage project schedules internally and externally, coordinating resources across technical, product, clinical, and client success teams, and proactively mitigate potential conflicts.

  • Client Success Support: Collaborate with the Client Success team to align project outcomes with client goals, serve as the technical point of contact, manage feedback and issues reported by clients, and coordinate resolutions with product, clinical, and technical teams. .

  • Resource Management: Allocate resources across projects, address capacity constraints, and recommend additional support as needed.

  • Risk Management: Identify and mitigate risks, such as technical challenges and resource constraints, to protect timelines and client satisfaction.

  • Reporting & Communication: Provide regular status updates to senior leadership and clients, including project progress, risks, and outcomes. Prepare presentations on lessons learned.

Who You Are:

  • You have a bachelor’s degree in Project Management, Information Technology / Systems, Business Administration, or a related field.

  • You have 5+ years of experience in leading and managing cross-functional technical projects, preferably in healthcare.

  • Proven ability to succeed in start-up and scale-up companies

  • Ability to understand and discuss technical concepts including integration approaches, data interfaces, schemas, etc.

  • Experience with electronic health record (EHR) system integration and health IT interoperability standards is highly preferred.

  • Proven experience and track record creating operational efficiencies and improvements in order to accelerate project timelines.

  • You have a strong knowledge of project management tools that can be used to improve transparency and operations

  • You have excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with a strong ability to manage client and cross-functional relationships.

  • Willing to travel 10-20% of the time for client go-live support

Skills:

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

  • Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously

  • Exceptional organizational skills with attention to detail

  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team

  • Strong understanding of technology and project life-cycles

Why join us:

  • Opportunity to work on impactful health projects with leading healthcare clients.

  • Collaborative and supportive team environment.

  • Competitive salary and benefits package.

  • Professional growth and development opportunities.

jobs.title: Senior Forward Deployed Software Engineer, Data
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Senior Forward Deployed Software Engineer, Data

In Brief

  •  We’re an early-stage startup that’s building a health AI platform to help clinicians make better use of real-time data to reduce preventable complications and save patient lives.

  • We’re looking for a software engineer with breadth of experience across technical stacks who wants to make an impact in the healthcare space.

Who We Are

Bayesian Health’s mission is to improve patient outcomes by empowering clinicians with the insights they need to make the right decision for the right patient at the point-of-care. We’re a diverse team of clinicians, engineers, machine learning experts, product designers, and performance improvement leaders committed to enabling smarter, patient-specific care delivery through unlocking the power of data.

We’re funded by top tier tech and biotech investors: Andreessen Horowitz, American Medical Association’s venture arm, Catalio Partners, and LifeForce Capital. Our company has won many awards; most recent recognitions include: Forbes AI Top 50, World Economic Forum Tech Pioneer, Time Best Inventions, BioTech AI Company of the Year.

Read more about our recent publication in Nature Medicine that associates our products with lives saved.

What You’ll Do

Lead the integration of our clinical AI platform and application with our health system clients’ electronic health records (EHR) involving cross-functional collaboration with Client Success, Clinical, Product, and Data Science. You’ll play an important role in building automation and tooling to reduce integration resources and timeline that’s crucial as we expand our client base. Additionally, you will help us build the rest of the Forward Deployed team we are investing heavily in, given the importance and impact of these roles as our company grows.

Responsibilities:

  • Leading enterprise client implementations: As the technical lead of a client project, you’ll work with the client to understand the best integration strategy, and own the planning and execution of the project end-to-end.

  • Optimizing: Develop frameworks and tooling to increase efficiency and velocity of client implementations.

  • End-to-end testing: Create and execute testing plans to ensure smooth and timely integrations.

  • Team building: Partner with the Director of Engineering to define hiring strategy for future Forward Deployed Software Engineer hires.

  • Cross-functional collaboration: Work closely with Client Success, Clinical, Product, and Data Science to drive alignment and deliver impactful technology that saves lives.

Minimum qualifications:

  • BS in Computer Science or other relevant technical discipline, with 5+ years as a forward deployed engineer.

  • 4+ years developing and deploying production quality applications for clients (Python preferred)

  • 4+ years of experience creating and presenting technical design proposals that include technical specifications, implementation and test plans.

  • Experience using cloud solutions (AWS, Azure, etc) and relational databases (Postgresql, MySQL, etc) in a production environment.

  • Strong communication and presentation skills

Preferred qualification:

  • Experience with health data, integration with electronic health records (EHR) systems, and Health IT interoperability standards.

  • Experience working with enterprise customers, and the agility and responsiveness they require.

  • Excitement for Bayesian’s mission and being a bar raiser so we can accelerate the pace at which we create value.

Bayesian Health provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

jobs.title: Strategic Account Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Strategic Account Manager

In Brief

  • We’re a rapidly growing startup on a mission to make healthcare proactive by empowering physicians, nurses, and care team members with real-time data to save lives.

  • We’re looking for someone with 5+ years of experience in Enterprise Client Success, Project Management and Strategic Account Management who’s comfortable leading cross-functional clinical teams to deliver value with complex customers and has a history of driving tangible results (i.e. utilization, customer satisfaction and expansion).

Who We Are

Bayesian Health’s mission is to improve patient outcomes by empowering clinicians with the insights they need to make the right decision for the right patient at the point-of-care. We’re a diverse team of clinicians, engineers, machine learning experts, product designers, and performance improvement leaders committed to enabling smarter, patient-specific care delivery through unlocking the power of data.

What makes us different? We’re results oriented and outcomes obsessed. We also understand that to address our users’ needs, we must go beyond building great technology. After spending a decade working side by side with top clinicians from three of the world’s leading health systems, we know what it takes to develop usable, high-value, clinically-relevant solutions. We are experts at rummaging through messy, incomplete, biased datasets. We are able to make sense of, and continuously learn from data, to help our physicians practice more precise medicine.

Read more about our recent publication in Nature Medicine that associates our products with lives saved.

What You’ll Do

This role bridges the gap between our health system clients, our market-facing team, and our product team. This role is successful when clients are happy, referenceable, and achieving clinical outcome goals.

You will:

  • Lead the implementation process for enterprise solutions, working closely with clients to ensure successful deployment.

  • Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with key clients, serving as their primary point of contact.

  • Lead cross-functional teams to drive successful implementation of Bayesian Health technology in large, complex health systems.

  • Gain buy-in from nursing and physician stakeholders to drive adoption.

  • Lead cross-functional team to build and deliver overarching narrative regarding value that Bayesian brings to each health system customer.

  • Support research and evaluation of Bayesian Health modules.

  • Identify gaps and barriers to achieving clinical outcomes and recommend countermeasures.

  • Develop repeatable processes internally for success and scale the Client Success team as the business grows

  • Contribute to the product roadmap by anticipating client needs.

  • Travel an average of 20% (including overnight) to client sites to provide support.

  • Be an integral part of our diverse, inclusive, collaborative, fully-remote Client Success team.

  • Other duties as assigned.

Who You Are

  • You have 5+ years of experience in a Client Success, Project Management or Account Management role. In this role, you managed high priority customers and had a track record of driving renewals and expansion.

  • You are passionate about making clinical care more effective and efficient. You believe technology has the power to inform clinical decisions early, and you want to make that a reality.

  • You have an executive presence and grit. You’re comfortable leading executive and frontline teams, and you’re able to articulate complex technology to audiences of varying backgrounds.

  • You’re results oriented. Everything you do contributes to achieving a specific outcome, and you have a track record of exceeding expectations.

  • Continuous improvement and start-up, scrappy culture is in your DNA. You question the status quo and look for ways to drive efficiencies internally and externally.

  • You have a track record as a collaborative, driven team player with a high sense of ownership.

Nice to Have

  • Demonstrated problem solving through research or projects

  • Ability to understand and interpret clinical research

—

Bayesian Health provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

jobs.title: Senior Test Engineer, Clinical AI/ML Products
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Senior Test Engineer, Clinical AI/ML Products

In Brief

  • We’re an early-stage startup on a mission to make healthcare proactive by empowering physicians, nurses, and care team members with real-time data to save lives.

  • You will play an instrumental role, working closely with product managers, clinicians, software engineers, data scientists, and regulatory, to ensure our clinical AI/ML products exceed enterprise health system quality standards and regulatory requirements for reliable, safe, and effective patient care.

Who We Are

Bayesian Health’s mission is to improve patient outcomes by empowering clinicians with the insights they need to make the right decision for the right patient at the point-of-care. We’re a diverse team of clinicians, engineers, machine learning experts, product designers, and performance improvement leaders committed to enabling smarter, patient-specific care delivery through unlocking the power of data.

We’re funded by top tier tech and biotech investors: Obvious Ventures, Andreessen Horowitz, American Medical Association’s venture arm, Catalio Partners, and LifeForce Capital. Our company has won many awards; most recent recognitions include: Forbes AI Top 50, World Economic Forum Tech Pioneer, Time Best Inventions, BioTech AI Company of the Year.

Read more about our recent publication in Nature Medicine that associates our products with lives saved.

What you’ll do

As a Software Test Engineer, Clinical AI/ML Products, you will work closely with product managers, clinicians, client success, regulatory, data scientists, and other software engineers to develop verification protocols and automated tests ensuring we ship high quality, safe, secure, and regulatory-compliant clinical AI/ML products on a scalable and reliable platform for enterprise health systems. You’ll play an important role to expand and scale our clinical AI/ML module offerings with a high impact on our company revenue growth.

Responsibilities

  • Clinical AI/ML product quality: Partner with the product subject matter experts (SME) to define test requirements, create and execute test plans, both manual and automated, to ensure our products meet clinical workflow expectations, quality standards, and regulatory requirements.

  • Test automation: Build the framework and tooling to automatically run tests and verification efficiently that will enable us to accelerate our product development and integration.

  • Streamlining client integration testing: Consolidate and simplify integrated testing with our enterprise health system clients to reduce manual testing effort.

  • Cross Functional Collaboration: Work closely with product managers, clinicians, regulatory, data scientists, and other software engineers to drive alignment on quality at the company level and deliver impactful technology that saves lives.

Minimum qualifications

  • BS in Computer Science or other relevant technical discipline.

  • 5+ years of experience in leading testing for complex cross-functional technical projects.

  • 4+ years of experience in developing test cases using automated testing frameworks (Cypress, Selenium, etc.) and executing them in CI/CD pipelines.

jobs.title: Clinical Product Operations
jobs.descriptionHtml:
In Brief

  • We’re a rapidly growing startup on a mission to make healthcare proactive by empowering clinicians with real-time data to save lives.

  • You will be the connective tissue between our nimble product, clinical, and technical teams. As a leader you will ensure that we are all speaking the same language to prioritize and deliver high quality solutions that save patient lives. From shaping scalable electronic health record (EHR) integrations to operationalizing post-market Software as a Medical Device (SaMD) requirements, you’ll bring clarity and order to our complexity that enables us to move fast without breaking things for our frontline providers and their patients.

Who We Are

At Bayesian Health we recognize that to remain viable, healthcare systems must find new ways to deliver consistent, high-quality care with fewer resources. Bayesian Health’s continuously expanding Clinical Intelligence Platform integrates into leading EMR vendors to transform complex data into actionable AI-powered insights. We are on a mission to build products that go beyond flagging to allow clinicians to focus on what matters most. 

We’re a diverse and experienced team of AI/ML experts, software engineers, product designers, behavior change specialists, and clinicians. We’re not afraid of hard problems and are highly results-oriented. We also like to have fun while we’re working on hard things. Our culture is highly collaborative, inclusive, supportive, and we have a strict “no jerks” policy.

We’re funded by top tier tech and biotech investors: Andreessen Horowitz, American Medical Association’s venture arm, Catalio Partners, and LifeForce Capital. Our company has won many awards; most recent recognitions include: Forbes AI Top 50, World Economic Forum Tech Pioneer, Time Best Inventions, BioTech AI Company of the Year.

Read more about our recent publication in Nature Medicine that associates our products with lives saved.

What You’ll Do

As a Clinical Product Operations Lead you are not content with handing off a piece of communication and hoping for the best. Your attention to detail drives you to ensure that a product comes to life - shaping thorough scoping, identifying risks and edge cases, driving testing, considering client success and user education, and seeing it all the way to a clinical user’s screen. With a rich understanding of healthcare, you understand that delivering a product does not ensure adoption or scalability, which is why workflows are critical to our technical success. You can move seamlessly between stakeholders and are just as comfortable reining technical requirements in JIRA or debugging an HL7 or FHIR mapping issue as you are explaining the tradeoffs of a flowsheet writeback to a nurse leader.

Responsibilities 

  • Own cross-functional product execution from scoping through delivery—driving alignment between clinical, technical, and operational stakeholders to ensure features are launched on time and with impact.

  • Translate clinical workflows into buildable requirements by collaborating closely with nurses, physicians, engineers, and data scientists to ensure our tools work in the real world.

  • Drive process excellence by standing up and scaling repeatable systems for roadmap planning, sprint execution, testing, and post-release monitoring—balancing speed with quality.

  • Advocate for the clinician end-user by keeping usability, alert fatigue, and workflow integration at the center of every product decision.

  • Lead voice-of-customer synthesis to transform feedback from health systems into structured insights that guide roadmap prioritization and product design.

  • Communicate clearly and consistently across teams—owning documentation, timelines, and status updates to keep everyone focused and accountable.

Minimum Qualifications 

  • 3+ years of clinical experience with 2+ years as a nurse informaticist with strong acumen of multiple EHR platforms (e.g. Epic, Cerner)

  • 3+ years working within health systems to optimizing clinical workflows for EHR solutions

  • Experience managing large, complex, cross-functional EHR platform projects

  • Rich understanding of data structures and flows to meet documentation requirements and integration needs for EHR integrated technical products

  • Experience writing test scripts for multiple personas

  • Experience working on projects with ambiguity and uncertainty

    Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience working in a start up with the ability to wear multiple hats

  • Experience working in technical applications or optimizing products that drive clinical workflow efficiency (Figma, Jira, Miro, Parabol)

  • Experience with voice of customer process and creating positive vignettes for driving product adoption (e.g. using Pendo, Polly, Zendesk, Zeda.io or Guru)

  • Experience driving requirements and mapping from EHRs to a technical product solution (HL7 and FHIR)Experience working with data scientists to create data-driven product solutions. Experience querying data with SQL and building dashboards

  • Experience with advanced Slack integration tools (Slack AI, Agentforce, Workflow builder, Guru, Pylon, Clearfeed, Polly AI)

Bayesian Health provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

jobs.title: Physician Consultant (Part Time)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
In Brief

  • We’re an early-stage startup that’s building a health AI platform to help clinicians make better use of real-time data to reduce preventable complications and save patient lives.

  • We’re looking for board certified physicians with at least 5 years of clinical experience who have also participated in clinical studies for regulatory submission.

Who We Are

We’re using state-of-the-art tech to build AI co-pilots for doctors and nurses to literally help them save lives! Read more here about the recent publication on the cover of Nature Medicine of our large, two-year study of the effectiveness of our platform. 

We’re not afraid of hard problems and are highly results-oriented. We also like to have fun while we’re working on hard things. Our culture is highly collaborative, inclusive, supportive, and we have a strict “no jerks” policy.

We’re funded by top tier tech and biotech investors: Andreessen Horowitz, American Medical Association’s venture arm, Catalio Partners, and LifeForce Capital. Our company has won many awards; most recent recognition includes: AI Top 50, World Economic Forum Tech Pioneer, UCSF Digital Health Top 3 emerging startups in digital health.

Who You Are

  • MD, MBBS, or DO

  • Board certified in Medical or Surgical Critical Care (CC), Infectious Diseases (ID), Emergency Medicine (EM), Internal Medicine (IM), General Surgery (GS) or related fields

  • At least 5 years of clinical experience

  • Prior experience with clinical informatics or clinical decision support tools

  • Prior clinical trials experience – either as PI or data safety monitor. Experience taking clinical trial data to FDA Panel (drug or device) preferred

  • Experience as part of a sepsis committee is preferred

What You’ll Do

If you are comfortable with ambiguity, enjoy rolling up your sleeves and diving in to figure things out, we will need you to:

  • Support clinical study adjudication requirements

  • Review specific cases and provide clinical justification

  • Provide documentation of clinical determination

jobs.title: Staff Machine Learning Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Staff Machine Learning Engineer

In Brief

  • We’re an early-stage startup on a mission to make healthcare proactive by empowering physicians, nurses, and care team members with real-time data to save lives.

  • Part Data Scientist (building models), part Applied Scientist (productionizing models), and part MLE (deploying, maintaining), also known as “Full Stack Data Scientist” – someone who wants to own the end-to-end effectiveness of their real-time models in a live, clinical AI product.

Who We Are

Bayesian Health’s mission is to improve patient outcomes by empowering clinicians with the insights they need to make the right decision for the right patient at the point-of-care. We’re a diverse team of clinicians, engineers, machine learning experts, product designers, and performance improvement leaders committed to enabling smarter, patient-specific care delivery through unlocking the power of data.

We’re funded by top tier tech and biotech investors: Andreessen Horowitz, American Medical Association’s venture arm, Catalio Partners, and LifeForce Capital. Our company has won many awards; most recent recognitions include: Forbes AI Top 50, World Economic Forum Tech Pioneer, Time Best Inventions, BioTech AI Company of the Year.

Read more about our recent publication in Nature Medicine that associates our products with lives saved.

What You’ll Do

As a Staff Machine Learning Engineer, you are not satisfied with training and tuning ML models that predict clinical conditions in patients; you also want to own the effectiveness of your model in the real world. In practice, that means you aren’t afraid to get your hands dirty by writing data mapping code, debugging a specific patient case by following patient data as it moves through our AWS services, or improving the timeliness of your model’s predictions by reading and writing production-grade Python and SQL code.

Responsibilities

  • Model Prototyping: Develop and tune innovative, new ML models and labeler systems based on deep understanding of clinical use cases and state-of-the-art ML methods.

  • Productionizing: The same models that you develop with production-grade python. 

  • Deploying: Identify strategies for improving our production ML-based systems, and write, debug, and deploying production-grade Python code to implement those strategies.

  • MLOps: Build infrastructure that enables ML model development and deployment in production systems.

Minimum qualifications

  • Ph.D. in a relevant field plus 3+ years relevant experience, or a relevant Master’s degree and 5+ years experience shipping ML based software products.

  • Experience owning your ML models from prototyping to production.

  • Experience writing production-grade Python and SQL code to implement and evaluate ML models in production systems.

  • Experience using MLOps tools such as SageMaker and MLFlow.

Preferred qualifications

  • Experience going 0-1 and shipping high impact AI/ML products.

  • Experience building solutions within healthcare and/or familiarity working with messy health data.

  • Experience working with enterprise customers, and the agility and responsiveness they require.

  • Comfortable interpreting / leveraging state-of-the-art peer-reviewed methods or tools in designing your approach.

  • Excitement for Bayesian’s mission and being a bar raiser so we can accelerate the pace at which we create value.

Bayesian Health provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Read more about our recent publication in Nature Medicine that associates our products with lives saved. https://www.bayesianhealth.com/sepsis-research/?__hstc=251652889.1e7598f5de0ed9b513da684474e8a044.1710861879595.1710945070565.1710971833587.3&__hssc=251652889.1.1710971833587&__hsfp=1890770568


WHAT YOU’LL DO

As a Staff Machine Learning Engineer, you are not satisfied with training and tuning ML models that predict clinical conditions in patients; you also want to own the effectiveness of your model in the real world. In practice, that means you aren’t afraid to get your hands dirty by writing data mapping code, debugging a specific patient case by following patient data as it moves through our AWS services, or improving the timeliness of your model’s predictions by reading and writing production-grade Python and SQL code.


RESPONSIBILITIES

 - Model Prototyping: Develop and tune innovative, new ML models and labeler systems based on deep understanding of clinical use cases and state-of-the-art ML methods.

 - Productionizing: The same models that you develop with production-grade python. 

 - Deploying: Identify strategies for improving our production ML-based systems, and write, debug, and deploying production-grade Python code to implement those strategies.

 - MLOps: Build infrastructure that enables ML model development and deployment in production systems.


MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

 - Ph.D. in a relevant field plus 3+ years relevant experience, or a relevant Master’s degree and 5+ years experience shipping ML based software products.

 - Experience owning your ML models from prototyping to production.

 - Experience writing production-grade Python and SQL code to implement and evaluate ML models in production systems.

 - Experience using MLOps tools such as SageMaker and MLFlow.


PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

 - Experience going 0-1 and shipping high impact AI/ML products.

 - Experience building solutions within healthcare and/or familiarity working with messy health data.

 - Experience working with enterprise customers, and the agility and responsiveness they require.

 - Comfortable interpreting / leveraging state-of-the-art peer-reviewed methods or tools in designing your approach.

 - Excitement for Bayesian’s mission and being a bar raiser so we can accelerate the pace at which we create value.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer, Analytics
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Senior Software Engineer, Analytics

In Brief

  • We’re an early-stage startup on a mission to make healthcare proactive by empowering physicians, nurses, and care team members with real-time data to save lives.

  • You will lead the development of our clinical AI/ML product analytics infrastructure, frameworks, and tools to enable our client success, product, clinical, and technology teams to uplevel our decision making through better insights.

Who We Are

Bayesian Health’s mission is to improve patient outcomes by empowering clinicians with the insights they need to make the right decision for the right patient at the point-of-care. We’re a diverse team of clinicians, engineers, machine learning experts, product designers, and performance improvement leaders committed to enabling smarter, patient-specific care delivery through unlocking the power of data.

We’re funded by top tier tech and biotech investors: Obvious Ventures, Andreessen Horowitz, American Medical Association’s venture arm, Catalio Partners, and LifeForce Capital. Our company has won many awards; most recent recognitions include: Forbes AI Top 50, World Economic Forum Tech Pioneer, Time Best Inventions, BioTech AI Company of the Year.

Read more about our recent publication in Nature Medicine that associates our products with lives saved.

What you’ll do

As a Senior Software Engineer, Analytics, you will work closely with client success, product managers, clinicians, data scientists, and other software engineers to build infrastructure, frameworks, and tools to improve client analytics, facilitate clinical case reviews, and support product investigation. This role is crucial to provide internal visibility into product performance that will drive expansion of our clinical AI/ML module offerings and revenue growth.

Responsibilities

  • Product performance monitoring and optimization: Partner with client success and clinical product subject matter experts to implement the infrastructure, queries, and automation to monitor the KPIs and success metrics of our products across multiple clinical domains and clients.

  • Clinical case review and investigation: Build frameworks and tools to empower our clinical team to independently review and investigate clinical cases reported by our clients and identify cases with certain criteria that need further evaluation.

  • Data platform and analytics technical foundations: Propose and implement foundational improvements and innovations to boost our data platform scalability with expanding products and clients and uplevel our team analytics capabilities.

  • Drive product analytics development cross-functionally: Work closely with Client Success, Clinical, Product, Data Science, and Engineering to drive alignment on product analytics at the company level.

Minimum qualifications

  • BS in Computer Science or other relevant technical discipline.

  • 5+ years of experience in building scalable, secure analytics infrastructure and tools on a cloud platform (preferably AWS) to produce monitoring metrics and investigational data from complex data models and queries for live products and customers.

  • Proficient in Python and SQL.

  • Deep knowledge in modern data and analytics technologies, such as cloud-based data warehouses, transformation frameworks (e.g. dbt), workflow orchestration tools, and BI tools like Tableau or Quicksight, and keen ability to integrate with existing infrastructure to enhance capabilities.

  • Experience working with sensitive data that contains PHI/PII.

  • Excellent communication skills and a proven ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams (data science, product, clinical) to translate requirements into robust technical solutions

Preferred qualifications

  • Experience in leveraging LLMs in distributed data processing and analytics systems.

  • Experience building analytics technology for clinical/health data.

  • Experience handling ambiguity and uncertainty in a startup.

Bayesian Health provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

jobs.title: Senior/Staff Machine Learning Data Scientist
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Senior/Staff Machine Learning Data Scientist

In Brief

  • We’re an early-stage startup on a mission to make healthcare proactive by empowering physicians, nurses, and care team members with real-time data to save lives.

  • TLDR: Independent end-to-end model development with ability to work cross-functionally with Clinical, Engineering, and Product to clarify and prioritize specifications and features for our life-saving AI models.

Who We Are

Bayesian Health’s mission is to improve patient outcomes by empowering clinicians with the insights they need to make the right decision for the right patient at the point-of-care. We’re a diverse team of clinicians, engineers, machine learning experts, product designers, and performance improvement leaders committed to enabling smarter, patient-specific care delivery through unlocking the power of data.

We’re funded by top tier tech and biotech investors: Andreessen Horowitz, American Medical Association’s venture arm, Catalio Partners, and LifeForce Capital. Our company has won many awards; most recent recognitions include: Forbes AI Top 50, World Economic Forum Tech Pioneer, Time Best Inventions, BioTech AI Company of the Year.

Read more about our recent publication in Nature Medicine that associates our products with lives saved.

What you’ll do

As a Senior/Staff Machine Learning Data Scientist, you are not satisfied with training and tuning ML models that predict clinical conditions in patients; you also want to own the effectiveness of your model in the real world. In practice, that means you aren’t afraid to get your hands dirty by writing data mapping code, debugging a specific patient case by following patient data as it moves through our AWS services, or improving the timeliness of your model’s predictions by reading and writing production-grade Python and SQL code.

Responsibilities

  • Model Prototyping: Develop and tune innovative, new ML models and labeler systems based on deep understanding of clinical use cases and state-of-the-art ML methods

  • Productionizing: The same models that you develop with production-grade Python

  • Deploying: Identify strategies for improving our production ML-based systems, and write, debug, and deploy production-grade Python code to implement those strategies

  • Cross-Functional Alignment: Data Science for storytelling – understand model performance and metrics, and present this to technical and non-technical users, both internally and externally

Minimum qualifications

  • Ph.D. in a relevant field plus 3+ years experience shipping ML based software products

  • Experience owning your ML models from prototyping to production, especially real-time algorithms that update dynamically across time

  • Experience writing production-grade Python and SQL code to implement and evaluate ML models in production systems

  • Track record of using statistics and performance metrics to compare end-to-end ML and product performance

Preferred qualifications

  • Experience shipping breakthrough or 0-1 products from end to end, interpreting and leveraging State-of-the-Art methods to do so

  • Experience using messy clinical and health data to design new products for large Health Systems

  • Experience with any of the following: PyTorch, PySpark, HL7, FHIR, EHR, time series data, signal processing, MLFlow, anomaly detection, Bayesian statistics, quantile regression, time-series forecasting

  • You bring passion and enthusiasm to your work, and are excited to join a growing team to Get Stuff Done and save lives!



Bayesian Health provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.
